channel.title: Cybersecurity on FinanClub
channel.description: Recent content in Cybersecurity on FinanClub

item.title: FTNT
item.description: score:215 Chances: Fortinet (FTNT) closed at $71.46, indicating a +0.15% shift from the previous trading day. Fortinet delivers a range of secure and integrated WLAN/LAN solutions, catering to various environments. Windstream Enterprise (WE) unveiled Secure Flex Premium, powered by Fortinet, providing a fully customizable cybersecurity infrastructure.

item.title: GEN
item.description: score:-43 Chances: Gen Digital’s fair value estimate is US$38.03 according to the 2 Stage Free Cash Flow to Equity analysis. Avast, a brand of Gen Digital, blocked an unprecedented 10 billion attacks in 2023, which shows the company’s strong performance in digital security.

item.title: MSFT
item.description: score:96 Chances: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella has achieved significant growth for the company, with the stock rising over 1,200% during his tenure. The acquisition of Activision-Blizzard and major investments in AI show Microsoft’s commitment to innovation and expansion. The company’s Intelligent Cloud segment, including Azure and other cloud services, continues to drive growth and revenue.

item.title: S
item.description: score:114 Chances: SentinelOne (S) has been upgraded to a Zacks Rank #1 (Strong Buy), reflecting growing optimism about the company’s earnings prospects. Shares of SentinelOne (S) jumped 5.2% in the morning session after BTIG analyst Gray Powell upgraded the stock’s rating from Neutral to Buy and assigned a price target of $30.

item.title: CRWD
item.description: score:172 Chances: CrowdStrike (CRWD) has received quite a bit of attention from Zacks.com users lately. Shares of cybersecurity company CrowdStrike (NASDAQ:CRWD) jumped 5.4% in the afternoon session after Morgan Stanley analyst Hamza Fodderwala upgraded the stock’s rating from Equal-Weight (Hold) to Overweight (Buy) and raised the price target from $203 to $304.

item.title: VFC
item.description: score:351 Chances: VF Corp. (VFC) shares fell over 7% Monday after the owner of the Vans and North Face shoe and apparel brands warned that the companyâ€™s business operations were disrupted by a cyberattack. VF said in a regulatory filing Monday that the hacker encrypted some IT systems and stole data, including personal information.
